description: This fruity, sweet wine is immediately attractive and ripe. With its great apricot and pineapple fruit, hints of spicy wood and balancing acidity, it's perfect as an apéritif—light and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 La Réserve Petit Manseng (Vin de France)

description: Rich almonds, ripe peaches and a smoky, oxidized character all come together in this ripe, complex, fascinating wine. There is a great tang of apple acidity on the finish. Drink now.
title: Domaine Daniel Dugois 2006 Vin Jaune Savagnin (Arbois)

description: Here is a simple but tasty Chard, offering attractive notes of pear, spiced orange and toasted apple skin on the nose and mouth. It's light weight and well balanced, with ample acidity and a short but clean finish. Enjoy now.
title: Kiwi Cuvée 2014 Bin 068 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Juicy dark plum, cherry and boysenberry are upfront on the nose, with additional seductive hints of purple violet and vanilla. The palate is plush and fruit-forward, with ample acidity and medium tannins that lend pleasant structure. Accents of sweet spice grace the finish.
title: Frédéric Brouca 2013 Samsó Seulle Cinsault (Vin de France)

description: For those with a classical bent, Clos Teddi is named after Thetis, sea goddess and mother of Achilles. This rosé, appropriately, summons up lunch by the ocean, with its crisp, fresh, dry strawberry and pink grapefruit flavors, just touched by caramel.
title: Clos Teddi 2007 Rosé Red (Patrimonio)

description: Chardonay and Pinot Noir are both present in this apple and pear flavored wine. A lively mousse brings out the fruit and acidity, giving a tangy, bright wine that's ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Rolet Père et Fils 2008 Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Jura)

description: This wine came out of the disaster of shriveled Duras grapes after an especially hot period. Rather than discarding them, Domaine Rotier made a wine. Wood aged, it has many of the characters of a late harvest with its rich, sweet, lightly tannic flavors and sufficient acidity to balance. A surprising success.
title: Domaine Rotier NV Noces de Feu Duras (Vin de Liqueur)

description: Made to be drunk young, this is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. It has a juicy blackberry flavor, plenty of acidity and a soft, smooth aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Rouge Tannat-Syrah Tannat-Syrah (Vin de France)

description: This typical blend from southwest France draws on the intensely herbal character of both grapes. It's crisp, perfumed and refreshingly fruity, making it a great apéritif.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Sauvignon-Colombard White (Vin de France)

description: Soft and fruity, this is an easy-to-drink wine. Its creamy texture and balanced acidity complement its apple flavors. It's ready to drink.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This light, cool-climate Pinot Noir is crisp with red currant fruit and herbal-tinged acidity. It has a zesty character that keeps it lively and tight. Drink now.
title: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Petite Perrière Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: The sunshine of the Languedoc comes through in this wine's warm, soft fruit. A touch of acidity and a backdrop of tannins give it contrast and a fine, ready-to-drink character.
title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Merlot (Vin de France)

description: This is just recognizably Pinot Noir, full of tannins with a tight edge. Bitter cherry flavors and very fresh acidity give a mineral flavor that is only just showing juiciness. Drink from 2016.
title: Les Rocailles 2014 Pinot Noir (Vin de Savoie)

description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this spicy wine has attractive acidity. It offers a light texture, pepper and a bite of orange zest at the end.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2014 Juliette Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This soft, gentle sparkling wine is fresh with raspberry fruits and acidity at the end. Drink as an apéritif.
title: Château Saint-Pierre NV Saint-Pierre Rosé Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This wine comes from a large family-owned estate on the island's east coast. It's loaded with bright fruit, crisp acidity and a rounded, ripe red berry-inflected aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Campu Vecchiu 2016 Rosé (Corse)

description: Consistently the top showing wine from the Le Val range, this is ripe and rounded, with a creamy texture and a toasty, spicy touch from light wood aging. Drink now.
title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Based in Burgundy, this producer understands Chardonnay. That's why this wine is so finely balanced, with a ripe and perfumed character and a warm, full aftertaste. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Tramier Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This organic wine, produced with a natural and biodynamic approach, is an interesting blend of 30% Syrah, 20% Grenache, 10% Mourvèdre, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Merlot, 10% Malbec and 10% Marselan. It offers pronounced earthy characteristics, as well as a citrusy kick (like tangerine oil) to the blueberry and blackberry fruit core. The mouthfeel is creamy and velvety, with plush tannins and lingering baking-spice flavors.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2014 Kosmos Organic Grapes Red (Vin de France)

description: This is a medium-bodied, spicy rendering of Syrah. Cherries, herbs and spice all mingle easily, while the silky texture is its calling card. Drink now–2023.
title: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2012 d'Ogier Syrah (Vin de France)

description: Made from the local Sciaccarellu grape, this is a delicious, light and perfumed wine. It has tight acidity to go with the red currant flavors and the crisp texture. The wine is poised and refreshing.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2015 Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: Soft and fruity with some sweetness, this red-fruit-flavored wine is rounded and warm, crispened by acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2011 Bistro Pinot Noir (Ile de Beauté)

description: This is a soft, gentle Pinot with a plum jelly flavor derived from a touch of sweetness in its fruit. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2010 Bourricot Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Rich and fragrant, this is perfumed with white flowers and lemon blossom. Apples, crisp pears and lime give a fresh and tightly fruity taste. The aftertaste is bright, while also rich. Drink now.
title: Les Rocailles 2014  Roussette de Savoie

description: A strongly perfumed wine, this is soft and just off-dry in character with some sucrosity. Crisp, fresh berry fruits are laced with acidity and finished with orange zest.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2014 Mireille Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This is an attractive, simple and, yes, an easy wine to drink. It has a pretty orange-pink color, crisp citrus fruit and the freshest final acidity.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2014 Easy Rosé (Mediterranée)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This wine is stalky with wild blackberry fruits and spicy acidity. It has a crisp edge, with a fresh character that comes through the herbal tannic flavors. It is all youth and fruit, so will be better from 2016. Chill lightly before drinking.
title: Les Rocailles 2014 Saint-Jean-de-la-Porte Mondeuse (Vin de Savoie)

description: Sweet and sparkling, this light, fresh wine is delicious on a hot day or as an apéritif. It is crisp with red berry fruits and a soft, sweet aftertaste that is cut with acidity.
title: Les Rocailles NV Caprice Gamay (Vin de France)

description: Hazelnut, white pepper and dried apples come together in this oxidative wine with a yeast and toast edge. There is intense acidity in this wine that is bone dry, very crisp and tightly controlled.
title: Domaine Buronfosse 2011 Varron Savagnin (Côtes du Jura)

description: Full of tropical fruits, this ripe, textured wine is rich in aromas and depth. Abundant peach and apricot flavors give immediate pleasure and attractiveness. Drink this opulent wine now.
title: Domaine Pignier 2011 A la Percenette Chardonnay (Côtes du Jura)

description: A perfumed wine, it is big on spiced apricots and ripe fruitiness. It is rich, full in the mouth with a slight oxidative aftertaste of almonds and walnuts that gives a sense of maturity. Drink now.
title: Rijckaert 2009 Les Grands Elevages Savagnin (Arbois)

description: Made from a grape that probably hails from the Somontano region of Spain (where it is known as Parraleta) this is a tight, stalky wine that has acidity and black currant fruit in abundance. Its tannins are more restrained than the fruit, allowing a light structure to hold up the juicy acidity and crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Clos Venturi 2015 1769 Carcajolu (Vin de France)

description: A soft, lightly fruity wine, this is light in texture and flavor, with the merest hints of citrus fruits, apples and tangy orange. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This wine is textured, tight and seems to be missing out on fruit. It has pepper, spice and just a few hints of green plums. There is a bitter aftertaste.
title: L'original French Kiss 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is soft, unfocused and gently fruity. Hints of herbal and citrus flavors give a green-fruit character to the wine, which has a tight, nervy aftertaste.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This wine is a soft, lean selection, with closed aromas and tight flavors of black currant and cherry that struggle to appear fully. The palate is clean but fleeting, with little texture and a short finish.
title: Voiturette 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: There's a wild character to the nose of this lean, tart Pinot. It offers aromas and flavors of game, sour cherry, tart raspberry and red currant, framed by soft tannins and a fleeting finish.
title: Maison de la Villette 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This is a jammy and fruit-forward selection, with direct aromas and flavors of red cherry, berry and plum that are lifted by a hint of menthol. The smooth, easygoing palate offers light tannins and fleshy fruit flavors, followed by a clean but fleeting finish.
title: Belle Made For You NV Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: An easy-drinking and non-offensive white, this offers light yet direct notes of citrus peel, melon rind and apple, with a bitter edge to the palate and a short but refreshing finish.
title: La Vieille Ferme 2014 White (Vin de France)

description: Mouthwatering acidity combines with a sweet aftertaste to give a wine that could be unbalanced but, surprisingly, has an attractive soft texture and easygoing fruitiness. Drink immediately.
title: Le Pépin 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This offers assertive aromas and flavors of banana, strawberry bubblegum, watermelon and blueberry. The palate is lightweight and fruity, with a sharp acidic edge and a short, fleeting finish.
title: Romantic 2015 Authentic & Chic Merlot (Vin de France)

description: This rosé is an extremely pale-pink color, with similarly light aromas of red cherry and currant on the nose. The palate is surprisingly round and somewhat flabby, with ripe red-fruit flavors and a touch of white chocolate on the finish.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This blend of 70% Grenache and 30% Carignan is smooth and easy to drink, with friendly aromas and flavors of red cherry and raspberry that are kissed by a hint of mentholated character. The tannins and low and the finish is short; drink up.
title: Belle Made For You NV Red (Vin de France)

description: There's an initial astringency to the bouquet of this wine, presented in scents of red-cherry skin, apple and raspberry leaf. The palate offers more of the same, with bitter tannins and fruit-skin flavors that lead into a finish reminiscent of oversteeped black tea.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Marquis de Brim Grande Réserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: Hints of menthol and cherry cough drop are upfront on the nose. Flavors of red currant, rhubarb and sour raspberry appear on the crisp, tart palate, finishing clean yet short.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This light, gently fruity wine has a soft, candied pear and apple flavor that is open, immediately accessible. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Almost as a challenge, owners Pascal et Jean-Marc Verhaeghe set out to prove that Malbec could produce a fine Port-style fortified wine. It works: its ripe sweetness and the balance between brandy and wine are just right. Jammy black cherry flavors and soft tannins give it a rich, velvety character. Drink now.
title: Château du Cèdre 2014 Le Cèdre Vintage Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

description: From the Seysses family of Domaine Dujac in Burgundy, this wine hails from east of Aix-en-Provence. It's crisp and fruity with red currant brightness. Acidity and tangy citrus give it a fresh feel. Drink now.
title: Triennes 2016 Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This is a full, fragrant and brilliantly fresh wine. It is crisp, with a rounded character that gives richness to the bright apples and pear-skin flavors. Lively while ripe, it has an attractive, mineral aftertaste.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2014  Roussette de Savoie

description: Firmly tannic, this is a structured wine that now lacks fruitiness. It needs to be drunk now.
title: Château d'Arlay 2007 Pinot Noir (Côtes du Jura)

description: An apple fresh wine, just off dry, with attractive acidity. Floral and aromatic wine, it has a crisp aftertaste.
title: Marquis de la Tour NV Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Red currant aromas are an immediately attractive start for this light, fruity wine. With its crisp acidity and bright red currant and raspberry fruit, it's lively and ready to drink.
title: Les Rocailles 2016 Rosé (Savoie)

description: Lightly pink in color, this sweet sparkling wine is full of ripe strawberry fruit. And with its low alcohol, it's the perfect pairing for strawberries and cream. Acidity keeps it in balance.
title: Les Rocailles NV Caprice des Rocailles Gamay (Savoie)

description: Lightweight, very herbal Sauvignon Blanc, full of green fruits, lemon zest and refreshing acidity. Ready to drink, it finishes as fresh as can be. Screwcap.
title: Guy Saget 2010 La Petite Perrière Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This wood-aged blend of seven grape varieties is sourced from biodynamic vineyards. It's richly structured and dense, with fine tannins and bold red plum fruit. Balanced, with a crisp aftertaste, it's ready to drink.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2014 Kosmos Red (Vin de France)

description: From vineyards on the east coast of Corsica, near Lake Diana, this bright Vermentino has a delicate perfume and a tangy edge. Pear and crisp apple flavors dominate the palate. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Petroni Vermentino (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: Named after the many panoramic capes along the Atlantic coast of southwest France, this fine blend of Colombard, Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc is bright and crisp with lively acidity and a juicy, herbal character. Drink now, preferably near the sea.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

description: Related to Syrah, Mondeuse is one of the main red grapes in the Savoie region. This light, fruity wine is typical of the style, with its tight acidity, attractive red fruit and touch of pepper at the end. Ready to drink.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2016 Mondeuse (Savoie)

description: One of a pair of single variety rosés from Eric Poli, this is crisp, with an earthy edge typical of this grape. Its red currant fruit and acidity offer a delicious, refreshing contrast. Drink now.
title: Domaine Poli 2016 Sciaccarellu Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine is soft, with raspberry flavors and acidity in equal abundance. It's light in color, tastes mature and should be drunk now.
title: Domaine Torraccia 2013 Red (Corse Porto Vecchio)

description: Fortified Tannat certainly has tannins, but it lends itself well to this sweet style. It's rich, obviously ageworthy with ripe black fruits and concentrated sweetness that's balanced by acidity. It should be aged until 2018.
title: Château d'Aydie 2011 Maydie Vintage Tannat (Vin de Liqueur)

description: Ripe white fruits are cut by a refreshing grapefruit acidity. It's so bright, crisp with a bounce to its texture that's irresistible. The aftertaste is a shower of bright flavors. Drink now.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2013 Vielle Vigne d'Idylle Jacquère (Vin de Savoie)

description: Rich, fruity and very ripe, this is a wine with toast, spice and luscious apricot and green plum flavors. Still young, it has intense potential to yield a full-bodied, intense wine with great acidity as well as fruitiness.
title: Domaine Daniel Dugois 2011 Auréoline Savagnin (Arbois)

description: A complex blend of 23 varieties, from a Languedoc vineyard originally planted in 1905. This has firm, rustic character, with dry tannins, dense black fruit and fresh, juicy acidity. There is a softness at the end, giving black currant acidity to finish.
title: Domaine de la Tour Boisée 2006 Plantation 1905 Red (Vin de Table Francais)

description: This is a fat, soft and smooth wine. It has juicy red fruit and acidity, with light tannins that lend support. It's ready to drink.
title: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Le Phare Merlot Merlot (Atlantique)

description: Named after the many lighthouses which guide sailors on the French Atlantic coast, this soft and fruity wine is made from 100% Merlot. Crisp, with plenty of red fruit, it's light and ready to drink.
title: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Le Phare Rosé (Atlantique)

description: Although this is labeled as Vin de France, its fruit comes from the La Bégude estate in Bandol. With one year's aging, it is full, soft and ripe with generous strawberry flavors. Dark in color, it may not follow the trend in Provence for pale rosés and its taste is rich and full bodied. The acidity at the end gives the necessary freshness.
title: Domaine de la Bégude 2014 L'Irréductible Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is an attractive, fruity, creamy wine that's full of rich yellow and white fruits. It's ripe and rich in feel, but the smoothness is layered with textured acidity and touches of vanilla that add complexity.
title: Domaine les Cantates 2012 Roussanne (Chignin-Bergeron)

description: This sweet, fortified dessert wine is very Port-like. It has remarkable structure with dark tannins that encase jammy blackberry flavors. It's full bodied, but brightened with acidity. Ready to drink now, it would be an ideal after-dinner drink.
title: Château d'Aydie 2010 Maydie Vintage Tannat (Vin de Liqueur)

description: This dry white wine, made from red Malbec grapes is intensely aromatic with quince, almond and lychee notes. It's a fascinating combination that has produced a rare style of wine. Although it is dry, its perfumed character brings out ripeness on the palate.
title: Château de Gaudou 2012 Blanc de Noir Malbec (Vin de France)

description: The perfumed character of this pure Vermentino is right up front. It gives the wine its ripe character and fine orange blossom aromas. The wine is crisp, juicy and with a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Clos Teddi 2015 Vermentino (Patrimonio)

description: This blend that seems to include every Corsican and Provence red grape works out as a wild and wonderful wine. With acidity, spice, perfume and tannins that bring in a bramble texture, this is a wine for drinking young.
title: Domaine Maestracci 2015 Clos Reginu Red

description: An attractively crisp wine, this has fragrant acidity and a lively raspberry-fruit character cut with a tight mineral edge. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Yves Leccia 2015 YL Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: This is a wine that has a curious metallic character. It masks the fruit and gives it a hard edge. It's fresh, but not immediately attractive.
title: Domaine Buronfosse 2011 Sparkling (Crémant de Jura)

description: Structured with a core of tannin, this is a ripe wine. It has layers of red fruit and attractive acidity, showing the potential to last a few more months before drinking.
title: Vins Descombe NV Rouge Carmin Red (Vin de France)

description: Part of a new range from this producer featuring rare grapes, this is made from a cross between Tannat and Cabernet Sauvignon, developed in 1955. The wine is like a trip back in time to the era when reds were high in tannins and acidity. It's a curiosity for those who like such things.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 Ekigaïna (Vin de France)

description: Made from the Négrette grape found in Fronton near Toulouse, this wine has a light structure to balance its dry acidity and citrus crispness. It's packed with clean, forward red currant fruit, ready to drink now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Villa la Vie en Rose Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This wine is crisp with refreshing acidity and fine lemon and grapefruit flavors. It's light and poised while still packing tangy fruit. Drink now.
title: Bernard et Christophe Richel 2016 Apremont Jacquère (Vin de Savoie)

description: This full bodied, fruity wine exhibits Chenin's characteristically chalky edge. The wine is tight, fresh and crisp—a great dry apéritif wine—offering just a touch of bitterness on the finish. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2009 La Calèche Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Packed with acidity as much as fruit, this is a tight, intensely fresh wine. There are some hints of tannins from the Pinot Noir as well as raspberry fruits, although the crisp acidity shows most strongly.
title: Domaine de Savagny NV Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Crémant de Jura)

description: A strongly perfumed wine, this is soft and just off-dry in character with some sucrosity. Crisp, fresh berry fruits are laced with acidity and finished with orange zest.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2014 Mireille Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Light mousse and a soft texture give this wine an attractive berry-flavored freshness. A touch of light sweetness finishes the wine attractively.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de Saint-Louis NV Estandon Brut Rosé Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Produced from Malbec that comes mainly from the Cahors region, this soft, ripe and fruity wine has a light touch of tannins that show beneath the berry fruits, supple texture and tight acidity. It is ready to drink, but will be better in 2015.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 La Réserve Malbec (Vin de France)

description: A typical Gers blend of Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng from South West France, this is a spicy, fruity and elegantly light wine. It is fresh, crisp with grapefruit and pear juice flavors and ready to drink.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2013 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

description: It seems odd to produce a 100% Cabernet Franc wine in Bandol. However, the result is impressive and somehow seems to have a flavor of Provence, with its spice and herbal edge. The wine is rich, full and powerful, with good tannins and black fruits. Drink from 2020.
title: Château d'Azur 2014 Secret d'Azur Cabernet Franc (Vin de France)

description: This wine has bright black-currant fruit and some firm tannins. Crisp, it's packed with acidity giving a fresh feel. It will be better lightly chilled.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2015 Arbin Mondeuse (Savoie)

description: This wine is rich while also crisp. Refreshing red fruits are laced with a touch of orange peel and spice. A blend of the local Nieullucciu and Sciaccarellu, it is fruity and very ready to drink.
title: Domaine Vico 2015 Rosé (Corse)

description: Full and perfumed, this wine has a rich character, with ripe apples, green plums and lively acidity. With its wildflower aromas and touch of pepper, it is both delicious and evocative.
title: Domaine Vico 2015 Vermentino (Corse)

description: The old vines give extra depth and richness to this ripe, creamy wine. It still has the proper crisp, tight texture that gives these cool mountain wines their character. Melon, crisp pear and acidity are all well in balance with the tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Les Rocailles 2015 Apremont Vieilles Vignes Jacquère (Vin de Savoie)

description: This wine is attractively fruity, just off dry, offering creamed pear flavors cut with fresh acidity. Full of white flower perfumes, it's crisp and light in texture. Drink now.
title: Patient Cottat 2013 Le Grand Caillou Chenin Blanc (Vin de France)

description: With a high percentage of local Jacquère in the blend, this fruity wine has high acidity and cool, fresh feel. It is as light as a feather, highlighting bright fruit with a fresh, crisp aftertaste.
title: Les Rocailles NV Brut Sparkling (Vin de Savoie)

description: This juicy wine conveys a ripe black cherry and lightly spicy character. It's all about the fruit, right up front and with a fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château de Gaudou 2014 Gaudou Exception Malbec (Vin de France)

description: Packed with acidity as much as fruit, this is a tight, intensely fresh wine. There are some hints of tannins from the Pinot Noir as well as raspberry fruits, although the crisp acidity shows most strongly.
title: Domaine de Savagny NV Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Crémant de Jura)

description: This wine is laced with wood and spice. It is ripe and fruity, also having a strong pepper and toast character and a light sprinkling of tannin. Juicy cherries give a lift at the end. Drink now.
title: Patient Cottat 2013 Le Grand Caillou Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Red berry aromas and spicy fruit give a wine that is ripe and smooth, with just the lightest of tannins. It's all fruit—juicy and open. Drink now.
title: Famille Laplace 2016 Aramis Tannat-Syrah (Vin de France)

description: This classic blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir from Savoie has resulted in the palest rosé that rivals only Provence in color. It has a touch of tannin, plenty of red-fruit acidity and a soft, creamy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Les Rocailles NV Brut Rosé  (Vin de France)

description: This medium-bodied blend features aromas and flavors reminiscent of bubble gum and cantaloupe. It's mainly Grenache and Cinsault, which impart ample weight, balanced by some slightly bitter, pithy notes on the finish.
title: My Essential 2014 French Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Soft and lightly sweet at the end, it shows black and dried fruits, light tannins and spice from the wood aging. Drink now.
title: Le Petit Panier 2012 Merlot (Vin de France)

description: Old forgotten Corsican varieties have been revived for this imaginative blend. Vinified and aged in cement eggs, it has extra richness and concentration. Ripe melon, yellow fruit and spice notes mingle with its crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Clos Venturi 2014 Chiesa Nera White (Vin de France)

description: This is a light wine with red fruits, a stalky texture and cool, refreshing acidity. It's the style of wine that could well be better as a summer red, lightly chilled. The final texture shows crisp fruitiness.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2013 Arbin Mondeuse (Vin de Savoie)

description: Completely mature, this lightly wood-aged wine has a smooth, mushroom and red fruit flavor. A touch of tannin gives dryness and delicious, refreshing acidity as an aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Rolet Père et Fils 2009 Rouge Tradition Red (Arbois)

description: Named after the Citroën 2CV car still sometimes seen on French roads, this lightly tannic wine has black fruits and a stalky structure that serves as a reminder that Malbec can produce structured wines. As a contrast, the fruit and acidity at the end give a lift, so that the wine is ready to drink.
title: Voiturette 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)

description: This simple wine is full of fruit. There is no wood aging here, just ripe pear and apricot flavors that are gently textured. The wine, with its crisp final acidity, is ready to drink.
title: Ropiteau 2015 Les Plants Nobles Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Off dry in character, this wine is ripe, soft and with a buttery flavor. Green plums and apricots combine to give a wine that is round in texture with a tang of citrus at the end.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Marquis de Brim Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Soft and gently fruity, this has red-currant as well as red-plum flavors lightly cut with acidity. The aftertaste is soft, almost off dry. It is immediately attractive and drinkable.
designation: Alain de la Treille Le Rosé
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Le Rosé Rosé (Vin de France)

description: A blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier, this is attractive, fruity and perfumed. Touches of apricot balance with the green fruits and herbal edge. It's an easy wine to drink, best as an apéritif.
title: Cuvée Lion d'Or 2015 White (Vin de France)

description: This is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat, not often found although working well here. The perfumed Muscat nicely softens the herbal Sauvignon to give a wine that is almost honeyed, certainly attractive as an apéritif.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Gabriel Sauvignon Blanc-Muscat White (Vin de France)

description: This is a soft wine from a major Rhône valley producer. Attractive acidity gives it a crisp, bright feel. Tangy citrus and clean, light fruitiness are all there, balanced and ready to drink. Drink now.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Heavy and waxy, with overdone varietal aromas that seem oily. Lots of pepper and cumin, but what about the fruit and acidity? Nowhere to be found.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Vin de Pays de l'Ardeche Viognier (France)

description: The perfumed character of this pure Vermentino is right up front. It gives the wine its ripe character and fine orange blossom aromas. The wine is crisp, juicy and with a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Clos Teddi 2015 Vermentino (Patrimonio)

description: This blend that seems to include every Corsican and Provence red grape works out as a wild and wonderful wine. With acidity, spice, perfume and tannins that bring in a bramble texture, this is a wine for drinking young.
title: Domaine Maestracci 2015 Clos Reginu Red

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine with attractive acidity as well a tangy character. It is fresh, crisp and ready to go with its apple and lemon flavors. Drink now.
title: Jean Perrier et Fils 2015 Abymes Cuvée Gastronomie Jacquère (Savoie)

description: With its stalky edge and red fruits, this crisp red wine has acidity, some tight tannins and a juicy aftertaste. It is ready to drink young, possibly slightly chilled.
title: Jean Perrier et Fils 2015 Cuvée Gastronomie Mondeuse (Savoie)

description: Lively and crisp, this delicious, snow-fresh wine has apple and melon flavors over aromatic acidity. With its bright texture and lightly herbal edge it is a refreshing wine to drink now.
title: Les Rocailles 2015 Apremont Jacquère (Vin de Savoie)

description: An attractively crisp wine, this has fragrant acidity and a lively raspberry-fruit character cut with a tight mineral edge. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Yves Leccia 2015 YL Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: A lightly sparkling wine, this is refreshing and softly sweet with notes of honey and delicate acidity. Because it is low alcohol, it makes a delicious apéritif or accompaniment to dessert.
title: Domaine des Baumard NV Bulles d'Or Sparkling (Vin Pétillant)

description: This soft, young wine is all about red-berry fruits. With a touch of spice and acidity, it is should be drunk quickly while its fruitiness remain fresh.
title: Domaine Marengo 2014 Emiliu Grenache (Ile de Beauté)

description: Oxidative in character, this ripe wine has melon, spice and almond flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Marengo 2014 Appolonia Vermentino (Patrimonio)

description: Tannat, with its high tannins, seems to lend itself as well to sweet fortified wines as do the Douro grapes of Port country. This is sweet, but firmly, solidly tannic, packed with wild berries and an edge of spice.
title: Domaine Berthoumieu 2007 Tannatis Tannat (Vin de Liqueur)

description: This is an earthy, rustic wine with tannins that set its black fruit firmly in place. Juicy acidity and black currant flavor give it a lift on the finish. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Brigue NV Rouge Héritage Red (Vin de France)

description: Rose gold in color, this rosé smells fresh and inviting, with pleasant underripe strawberry, mango and citrus zest scents. The palate is similarly light-footed, yet ripe tropical fruit tones lend some substance and richness.
title: Domaine la Colombette 2016 Notorious Pink Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Produced from Languedoc grapes by the Château d'Esclans team in Provence, this is an easy, open wine with both red berry richness and delicious acidity Drink now.
title: Sacha Lichine 2016 Single Blend Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This fruity red wine has firm tannins and juicy acidity. Its soft, rounded aftertaste makes it easy and warm.
title: Tussock Jumper 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Sourced from vineyards on the east coast of Corsica, this attractive, fruity wine is made from 100% Sciaccarellu. Its lively, light and crisp red currant and lemon flavors make it ready to drink.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Marestango Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: This light, fruity wine is a perfect summer apéritif. With a crisp texture and attractive red fruit, it's lively and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Terra Santa Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: This is a pale, light-bodied rosé with aromas and flavors reminiscent of underripe peach and melon. It's clean, dry and even a bit austere on the finish, making it a fine apéritif.
title: La Vieille Ferme 2016 Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Syrah-like aromas make this an attractive, soft wine. Its red berry fruit and balanced acidity are well in place for warm-weather drinking.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Syrah Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This wine is fruity and soft, with hints of citrus and herbal flavors. Its acidity is bright and attractive. Drink now.
title: M. & J-F Bertrand 2016 Fleur de Carbonnel Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: From a Loire Valley-based producer, this wine is crisp and cool. It has herbal touches and lively, citrusy acidity. Drink now.
title: Villebois 2016 Loupart Le Petit Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This warm style of Sauvignon Blanc has easygoing acidity and gooseberry fruit flavors. It's lightly tangy, with a bright, crisp texture.
title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This is a soft, unfocused wine that only hints at fruitiness. It is rounded and full bodied, with a touch of pepper as well as lemon zest acidity at the end.
designation: Brut d'Argent Brut Blanc de Blancs
title: La Cheteau NV Brut d'Argent Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Prunelard (or Prunelart) is a Gaillac grape that had almost disappeared. Revived by a few enterprising producers, it produces a distinctly fruity, aromatic wine. This bottling's firm edge of tannins and juicy acidity contribute structure and intense fruitiness. Still bursting with youth, it should be aged for another year. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine des Terrisses 2015 Le Monde en Parle Prunelard (Vin de France)

description: The Chardonnay in this blend with Vermentino creates a smooth, unctuous texture. Acidity and richness combine to bring out citrus and apricot flavors. The end delivers a zesty, mineral tang. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Vetriccie White (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: This oddly named Cabernet Sauvignon is fine. It has light tannins, a juicy, stalky character, upfront black currant fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Romantic Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: This cool-climate Pinot Noir is soft and gentle. Its ripe tannins and cherry flavors are both lightly structured and juicy. Although still young, it's ready to drink.
designation: Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly
title: Eric Louis 2016 Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This is a smooth, ripe and generous wine befitting southern Merlot. It has just the right amount of acidity, black currant fruitiness and a smoky aftertaste.
title: Florent Descombe NV Merlot (Vin de France)

description: This spicy, strongly perfumed wine is full of fruit and juicy acidity. It's dry and structured, with a firm backdrop of tannins. It will be great for the winter.
title: Florent Descombe NV Syrah (Vin de France)

description: The rarely used Atlantique appellation covers much the same region as Bordeaux, with less stringent rules. This 100% Sauvignon Blanc wine is fruity, easy, soft and full of citrus flavors. Drink now.
title: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Atlantique)

description: Dark fruits—plum, cherry and blackberry—are bold and center stage on the nose, with secondary glimmers of licorice stick and black pepper. The palate offers black fruit-skin flavors that are partnered with medium tannins, resulting in a slightly gripping and astringent close.
title: Les Alliés 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: This easy-drinking Pinot leads with bright aromas of red currant, raspberry and strawberry hull, all leaning slightly sour. The palate is light and tangy, with tart red-berry flavors that finish clean.
title: Tussock Jumper 2014 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: A sweet blend of Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc, this wine boasts smooth, attractively honeyed fruit, along with a penetrating burst of acidity. Pineapple, peach and apple flavors blend well together, making this wine a great apéritif.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2012 Villa Chambre d'Amour White (Vin de France)

description: A wine that already shows some of the typical oxidative character of Savagnin. It creates a wine that has great style, richness and wonderful tangy, smoky character. It could age further, although it's ready to drink now.
title: Andre et Mireille Tissot 2010 Savagnin (Arbois)

description: A full-bodied, slightly oxidative wine that wears its character well. There is a toastiness here along with some apple and apricot fruits, giving a rich feel to the wine. It's ready to drink but can also continue to age until 2017–2018.
title: Andre et Mireille Tissot 2011 Les Graviers Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: This wine is smooth, floral and lightly honeyed. With tangy acidity that balances its creamy texture, it's also full, rich and stylish. Produced from the Vermentino grape (Vermentinu in the local dialect), it's generous and ready to drink.
title: Clos Alivu 2016 Vermentino (Patrimonio)

description: Pale in color, this oak-aged wine is soft, with juicy red fruit. It offers cinnamon and nutmeg flavors, as well as a smoky character from the wood. It finishes with intense, juicy acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Dugois 2016 La Sombarde Poulsard (Arbois)

description: This is a rich, perfumed wine, with spice from new wood, a rich texture and dense red berry fruit. Its structure and concentration suggest it will age further, so wait until late 2018 to drink.
title: Domaine Vico 2015 Red (Corse)

description: The Château-Chalon appellation can only make vin jaune and this exceptional example shows why this type of wine is unique. Balanced acids and fragrant fruitiness underpin the yeast, almond flavors and freshness. It is ready to drink in all its glory but will age for many, many years.
title: Domaine Berthet-Bondet 2006 Vin Jaune Savagnin (Château-Chalon)

description: This medium sweet wine has attractive yellow fruit and mango flavors. It's soft, with a touch of honey and crisper lemon juice accents. Drink now.
designation: Villa Chambre d'Amour Gros Manseng-Sauvignon Blanc
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Villa Chambre d'Amour Gros Manseng-Sauvignon Blanc White (Vin de France)

description: Hard and unyielding for Viognier, with lemon and mineral elements that seem a bit out of character for the variety. Nevertheless, it's a crisp refreshing white for the summer.
region: Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée
title: Domaine Juliette Avril 2007 Le Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée)

description: Pure Cabernet Sauvignon, this wines comes from the same region as Bordeaux. It has black currant flavors, balanced acidity and a touch of wood aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Le Phare Cabernet Sauvignon Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlantique)

description: This blend of Altesse, Jacquère and Chardonnay is bitter at first. That edge gives way to a creamy mousse that fills the mouth with nut, dried plum and spice flavors.The aftertaste is dry.
title: Les Rocailles NV Brut Sparkling (Vin de France)

description: This blend of Merlot, Tannat and Syrah comes from the southwest near the Atlantic Ocean. That locale gives the tannins and the juicy red fruits a cool, perfumed and lightly stalky character. The acidity is right there along with the soft berry aftertaste that makes the wine drinkable now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 Villa de Cocagne Red (Vin de France)

description: Ripe red berries, cherries and plums lead the bouquet of this friendly and approachable red. Those notes follow through to the creamy palate, while accents of carnation and pressed violet petals add depth and interest. A hint of sweet spice accents the finish.
title: L'original French Kiss NV Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Produced in the Languedoc, this wine tastes of the warmth and the sun. It has a touch of butter as well as ripe green-plum fruits. Acidity gives an attractive lift to this fruity, soft wine.
title: Pierre Moulin 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Based in Burgundy, Tramier should know something about Chardonnay. This wine has some structure that tastes of cool vineyards. It is crisp, with refreshing white fruit and green-plum flavors, and is ready to drink.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Romantic Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is a direct but tasty and well-balanced Pinot, with vibrant aromas and flavors of juicy cherry, blueberry and wild strawberry, all graced by hints of purple flowers and sweet spice. The mouthfeel is soft yet structured, with delicate tannins and a slight lushness that lingers on the finish.
title: Le Pépin 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Produced from 100% Niellucciu (Sangiovese), this wine is packed with intense acidity plus citrus and red-berry fruits. It is tangy and refreshing with its tight, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Poggiale 2015 Rosé (Corse)

description: This is a perfumed, citrus and apricot-flavored wine. It is crisp, with a ripe character that fills the mouth with rich fruitiness. It has a light, mineral structure and a long, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Poggiale 2015 Vermentino (Corse)

description: Pale in color, this wine offers attractive strawberry fruit, a good touch of acidity and few tannins. Drink this soft wine now.
title: Clos Venturi 2014 1769 Sciaccerellu (Corse)

description: Crisp and fruity, this bright wine is full of lively acidity, tangy citrus and apple fruit and refreshing acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2015 Cruet Jacquère (Savoie)

description: This is an attractively ripe blend of Niellucciu, Syrah and Grenache. Softly textured with a warm backdrop of blackberry fruit, the wine is spicy and has a distinctly southern-France feel. Its softness means it is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Petroni 2014 Red (Corse)

description: With its attractive red-fruit flavors, this is a light, perfumed wine. It has spice, fine acidity and a smooth texture that is just lifted by tannins. Drink now.
title: Château de Tigné 2014 Gerard Depardieu Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This ripe, rich wine is full of fruit. Sweet tannins have merged with the blackberry fruits, making it structured and dense. Spice, balancing acidity and a dark, firm aftertaste all promise further aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Clos Venturi 2014 Red (Corse)

description: There are edges of cocoa, pepper and curing spice to the dense red plum and cherry core of this attractive Syrah. Just a touch of gamy character throughout adds depth and intrigue. The rich fruit flavors continue on to the palate, with a texture like crushed satin and lingering notes of coffee, bittersweet chocolate and sweet spice.
title: Maison Nicolas Perrin 2014 Syrah (Vin de France)

description: This wine comes from the historic walled vineyard around the Château des Bachelards in Fleurie. It is floral, dense and spicy, rich with pepper, concentrated spice and tannins. With its dark character and still-firm tannins, the wine needs more time, so drink from 2017.
title: Château des Bachelards 2014 Le Clos Gamay

description: There is a curious imbalance here between Muscat's natural honey and very insistent acidity. The result is a wine that wants to be fresh, sweet and fruity, but doesn't fully succeed.
title: Royal Muscato NV White Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: The Négrette wines come mainly from a small area northwest of Toulouse although they are also found in pockets elsewhere in the southwest. This is a light and deliciously fruity wine, full of rosewater aromas and a bright aftertaste.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2015 La Vie en Rose Negrette (Vin de France)

description: Subtle peach, apricot and yellow melon dance in the bouquet of this medium-bodied wine. The palate is pithy and tart, leaner than the nose suggests, with nice vibrancy and a subtle spicy accent on the close. Enjoy now.
title: Michel Gassier 2014 Les Piliers Viognier (Vin de France)

description: The medium-intense nose of this solid and easy-to-like Cab offers scents of blackberry, cassis and plum, all laced by hints of cocoa and cigar box. The medium-weight mouth offers a pleasant texture, thanks to moderate tannins and ample acidity, with solid black-fruit flavors at the core.
title: Romantic 2014 Authentic & Chic Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: Produced from Niellucciu, this wine is ripe, perfumed and also packed with crisp acidity. Fresh raspberry, citrus and a touch of caramel are brought comfortably together by the acidity and zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Alivu 2015 Rosé (Patrimonio)

description: This is a blend of local grapes including Jacquère and Altesse. It is a ripe style of wine that is full of pear, melon and sweet orange fruit. It is ready to drink, fruity and deliciously bright.
title: Philippe Viallet 2015 White (Savoie)

description: This is a lush, seductive Carignan, offering initial notes of pepper, licorice and baking spice that harmonize into the dense black-fruit core. The palate is round and mouthfilling, with ample acidity and medium tannins that lend a pleasant structure. Rich blackberry and black-cherry flavors are infused with wood and sweet spice tones, finishing long.
title: Abbotts Delaunay 2013 Alto Stratus Carignan (Vin de France)

description: This is a juicy, fruit-forward selection, boasting vibrant notes of red cherry, raspberry and strawberry on the nose and mouth. A hint of vanilla adds a sweetness to the finish, which otherwise ends clean and mouthwatering. Drink now.
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Light, crisp and fruity, with a touch of vanilla, this simple, fresh wine is ready to drink. Rounded fruit and a tangy aftertaste complete an attractive wine.
title: Domaines Bunan 2014 Le Petit Rouvière Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: A richer version of a Saumur sparkling wine, this is soft, ripe and creamy. The dosage feels on the sweet side, although it is labeled Brut. There is just a touch of fruit skin texture to give it a firm edge, but there is also great final acidity.
title: Couly-Dutheil NV Brut de Franc Cabernet Franc (Vin Mousseux)

description: A fortified blend of Tannat and Malbec, this is a ripe and sweet, styled like a vintage Port. It has a powerful structure from the two tannic grapes in the blend, along with ripe damson fruit and spice, with acidity on the finish.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Estela Vintage Red (Vin de Liqueur)

description: This wine is rich, full of berry fruits and spice. The appealing juicy quality is crisp while also showing a balanced character. With a perfumed aftertaste, this attractive wine will be even better from 2016.
title: Les Rocailles 2014 Arbin Mondeuse (Vin de Savoie)

description: This is a pleasantly quaffable Viognier, with restrained apricot and melon aromas and flavors. It's medium bodied, without much texture, but a clean, refreshing finish.
region: Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée
title: Paul Jaboulet Aîné 2009 Secret de Famille Viognier (Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée)

description: Fresh and fruity with creamy green and white fruits, this is a soft, ready to drink Chardonnay. Attractively fruity, the acidity finely cuts through the wine.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2011 Bourricot Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This blend of two-thirds Syrah and one-third Mourvèdre is fresh and aromatic, showing some peppery-gingery spice to go with watermelon and strawberry notes. It's medium in body, with an abbreviated finish.
region: Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée
title: Jean-Luc Colombo 2013 Cape Bleue Rosé (Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée)

description: A blend of Mauzac and Loin de l'Oeil, commonly found in Gaillac, this bright, fruity and herbaceous wine is crisp and citrus-driven. A strong mineral edge to the texture adds bite to the aftertaste. Drink from 2015.
title: Château la Colombière 2014 Les Jacquaires White (Vin de France)

description: Produced from grapes from the island of Corsica, this soft, open Pinot Noir has some pleasing fresh berry fruits, hints of strawberries and soft tannins. Ready to drink now.
region: Vin de Pays de l'Ile de Beauté
title: Les Vins Skalli 2006 Robert Skalli South of France Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays de l'Ile de Beauté)

description: Vert de l'Or is a play on words for Verdelho, grown in Anjou since 1810. It is a richly textured wine, ripe with apple, but with a spicy, steely character. Black currants linger in the background of this dry, fragrant wine. Screwcap.
title: Domaine des Baumard 2012 Vert de l'Or Verdelho (Vin de Table Francais)

description: In a very Corsican style, this is a totally crisp blend of Nieillucciu, Sciaccarellu and Grenache. The first grape lends intense acidity while adding red currant and orange fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Petroni 2016 Rosé (Corse)

description: This rosé is warm and soft, with an attractive perfume and lively acidity to balance. Its red berry fruit is finished with a touch of spice that gives a final lift to the smooth vanilla-inflected aftertaste.
title: Florent Descombe NV Syrah Rosé (Vin de France)

description: With age, this 2002 has become fascinating, still showing sweetness while also offering dried fruits, prunes, figs and spice. A nutty character suggests the wine can still age for many years.
title: Château d'Arlay 2002 Vin de Paille White (Côtes du Jura)

description: This delicious, refreshing wine has crisp acidity and bright red apple fruit. Shot through with with zesty lemon character, it finishes with a waft of white floral perfume. Drink now.
title: Clos Poggiale 2016 Vermentino (Corse)

description: This perfumed wine, with its lychee aromas, is full and rich. That aromatic character continues on the palate, giving rich spice and lychee flavors that are cut with just enough acidity. It's full bodied and ripe and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Clos Venturi 2016 White (Corse)

description: Despite its light color, this is a wine for aging. Even now, the tannins are firm and give a dry texture to its red berry fruit. With acidity as well as structure, it's built for powerful meat dishes. Drink from 2018, when the tannins will have softened further.
title: Domaine Torraccia 2013 Oriu Réserve de Torraccia Red (Corse Porto Vecchio)

description: This warm wine brings out the roundness and open accessibility of warm-climate Chardonnay. With yellow fruits and clean acidity, it is attractively ready to drink.
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Despite its Vin de France designation, this is a typical wine from the Gascony area. With its crisp, lightly herbal character and deliciously light texture, it's fruity with citrus and red currant notes. Drink now.
title: Rubus 2015 White (Vin de France)

description: Ripe aromas of black plum, cherry and boysenberry are at the forefront of this richly fruited wine. The wine's lushness is complemented by hints of pepper and baking spice, as well as medium tannins that lend a subtle structure to the palate.
title: La Châsse 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Produced in the western end of the Loire, close to the Atlantic Ocean, this tightly herbal wine is packed with crisp lemon and grapefruit. It is dry, tangy and light, ready to drink.
title: La Forcine 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This lightly herbal wine is crisp and has a tangy mineral character. It's tight, green and full of citrus fruits. The acidity is right up front, keeping the wine fresh and bright at the end.
title: Le Val 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This wine is made to be drunk young when it is still in the first flush of its fruitiness. Black plum and blackberry flavors are fleshed out with soft tannins. The aftertaste is fresh with bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 La Réserve Malbec (Vin de France)

description: From the major Loire producer, this fresh and fruity wine shows the light touch of the region. With red-currant fruit sliced right through with acidity, the wine is lightly textured and ready to drink.
title: Saget la Perrière 2015 La Petite Perrière Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Oaky tones of vanilla bean, wood and sweet spice are at the fore of the bouquet, while notes of black cherry, stewed plum and raspberry coulis provide a solid backbone throughout. The mouthfeel is smooth and supple, with easy, approachable ripe-fruit flavors and a lingering hit of baking spice.
title: Confidence 2014 The Secret Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: This wine is an eclectic blend of Pinot Noir, Gamay, Mourvèdre and Grenache. The Pinot Noir's red fruits and smooth texture dominate, giving a soft wine with acidity and light tannins. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils NV Roncier Red (Vin de France)

description: This cool-climate wine is crisp, steely and full of fruit. Its acidity and touch of saltiness add to its refreshing nature.
title: Auguste Bonhomme 2016 La Forcine Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Produced from 100% Niellucciu (Sangiovese), this wine is packed with intense acidity plus citrus and red-berry fruits. It is tangy and refreshing with its tight, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Poggiale 2015 Rosé (Corse)

description: This is a perfumed, citrus and apricot-flavored wine. It is crisp, with a ripe character that fills the mouth with rich fruitiness. It has a light, mineral structure and a long, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Poggiale 2015 Vermentino (Corse)

description: Pale in color, this wine offers attractive strawberry fruit, a good touch of acidity and few tannins. Drink this soft wine now.
title: Clos Venturi 2014 1769 Sciaccerellu (Corse)

description: Light and bright, this wine is fruity with a soft, smooth texture that brings out pear and green-plum flavors. A refreshing wine, it's tangy, zesty and ready to drink.
title: Jean Perrier et Fils 2015 Apremont Cuvée Gastronomie Jacquère (Savoie)

description: Crisp and fruity, this bright wine is full of lively acidity, tangy citrus and apple fruit and refreshing acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2015 Cruet Jacquère (Savoie)

description: Sure it's a bit simple and fruity—the flavors run toward berries and citrus—but it's also cleanly made, with a slightly creamy mouthfeel and a soft, easy-drinking finish.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils NV Eclat Carmin Rosé Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Light and refreshing, with hints of berries and citrus alongside some herbal elements. The bead is a little on the large side, making the mouthfeel a bit rustic, but it'll do fine at the season's big holiday gatherings.
title: Kriter NV Eclat Carmin Rosé Sparkling (France)

description: Vin Jaune, one of the glories of Jura, is in good hands here. This wine is still developing, its oxidative, yeast and acidity still showing a fresher fruit character. Even now, still young, it is a wonderful, totally memorable wine.
title: Domaine Rolet Père et Fils 2005 Vin Jaune Savagnin (Arbois)

description: This pale, ruby red-colored wine comes from old vines planted at 900 feet in the hills. Two years wood aging and the natural concentration of the fruit have produced a finely poised wine with cherry flavors and a balanced layer of tannins. It's ready to drink.
title: Domaine Dugois 2014 Grevillière Trousseau (Arbois)

description: Soft, lightly creamy, with hints of raspberry and fresh red currants. The mousse is fleeting, leaving fruit and acidity.
title: Grandin NV Brut Rosé Méthode Traditionelle Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This wine is fruity and with a crisp texture. Bright and lively, it's juicy with pears and apples with lively final acidity. Drink this delicious wine now.
title: Bernard et Christophe Richel 2015 Apremont Jacquère (Vin de Savoie)

description: Produced from Niellucciu, this wine is ripe, perfumed and packed with crisp acidity. Fresh raspberry, citrus and a touch of caramel are brought together by the acidity and zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Alivu 2015 White (Patrimonio)

description: This is a ripe, orange and apricot-flavored wine. With a crisper citrus edge it is full, creamy and juicy. A mineral edge adds interest, bringing out the perfumed fruit. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Clos Teddi 2015 White (Patrimonio)

description: This wine is light, crisp and fruity, a real cool-climate red offering acidity, smoky black-currant fruit and a pinch of spice. The wine is ready to drink, with a mineral, fruity aftertaste.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2015 Mondeuse (Savoie)

description: Vines close to the east coast of Corsica give this bright, light and fruity wine. Crisp acidity is fleshed out with creamed apple and pear fruit. The wine is delicious to drink now.
title: Domaine de Terra Vecchia 2015 Vermentinu-Chardonnay White (Ile de Beauté)

description: It makes sense to produce this red sparkling wine in a medium-dry form. That's because the inevitable tannins are modified and are there to give shape to the strawberry fruits and fresh acidity. It's perhaps an acquired taste but would be fine with fruit desserts.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Rubis Excellence Demi-Sec Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Made from certified organic grapes, this is a medium-bodied blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Merlot. Bay leaf and black olive aromas add earthy notes on the palate, giving this ripe, chocolaty wine an anchor in the south of France. Drink now.
title: Famille Perrin 2014 L'Oustalet Red (Vin de France)

description: A hint of earthiness and tannins add complexity to this fruity, bright wine full of red berry flavors. It's fragrant, delicious and refreshingly juicy, but not for aging.
title: Domaine les Cantates 2011 Mondeuse (Chignin)

description: A Blanc de Noirs from Malbec, this aromatic wine has just a hint of tannins from the grape skins along with attractive acidity. It's a surprisingly fresh and fruity wine in the context of Malbec. Drink now.
title: Château de Gaudou NV Gaudou Exception Brut Malbec (Vin Mousseux)

description: This is a fruity, fresh wine full of black currant and berry flavor. Delicately structured, there's a vein of fresh green herbs and bell-pepper flavors that lend crispness to the finish.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2011 Mondeuse (Savoie)

description: Light, bright and fruity, this is a delicious glass of wine. It's fresh and crisp with fragrant white fruits layered with zesty citrus. It has a cool feel, with bright acidity adding lift to the finish.
title: Domaine les Cantates 2012 Jacquère (Chignin)

description: In the style of a Côtes de Gascogne white blend, this is a crisp, herbal and citrusy wine. It has considerable acidity along with pink grapefruit and lime flavors. Drink this light, bright wine now.
title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This blend of Niellucciu, Sciaccerellu and Syrah is both rich and stalky. That gives acidity, black currant fruit and a youthful texture. It's balanced with rich tannins which will allow it to age further. Drink from late 2018.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2015 Domaine Vetriccie Red (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: Spices, a hint of honey, a texture of pears and white plums—this is a rich, soft wine with a good intensity of taste and ripeness.
title: Domaine de Granajolo 2009 Blanc Vermentino (Corse Porto Vecchio)

description: Fresh and soft, with bright strawberry flavors and a delicious texture of red currants. Lively acidity gives the wine a great send-off.
title: Domaine de Granajolo 2009 Rosé (Corse Porto Vecchio)

description: What Baumard describes as a “secret blend” from its vineyards, this wine is both sweet and fresh. Honey and intense acidity are filled out with baked apple and lemon-marmalade flavors. It is ready to drink in all its fresh glory.
title: Domaine des Baumard NV Le Petit Paon White (Vin de France)

description: Oaky notes of buttered toast, dried apple slices and baked peach are upfront in the bouquet of this wine. The palate is similarly rich and round, but with ample acidity to keep it from falling completely flat. Flavors of orange creamsicle and spiced apple linger on the close.
title: Phantom Bay 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is a ripe and fruity rosé, with forward notes of lychee, rose water, peach gummies and tropical fruit salad. The palate is round and plump in similarly rich fruit flavors, with just enough acidity to keep it from feeling completely flat. Drink up.
title: Scarlet of Paris 2015 Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Earthy tones of menthol, licorice, black pepper and blackcurrant leaf compliment the blackberry and plum core of this lush yet soft Cab. The palate is plush and round, with light tannins and a sweet-oak finish.
title: Phantom Bay 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: A pleasant and easy-drinking selection, this leads with softly medicinal aromas of raspberry and red plum alongside a touch of violet. The palate is light and direct, with bright red-fruit flavors that finish short but clean.
title: Phantom Bay 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: A blend of local grapes with Syrah, this fruity wine enfolds a core of tannins. Stalky, smoky flavors balance with a red plum-skin texture and crisp acidity. It is young, the fruit still developing, so drink from 2017.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2013 Domaine Vetriccie Red (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: This soft and lightly herbal wine has a smooth texture that brings out its ripe red fruit and plays down its acidity. That makes it easy to drink, rich and generous on the finish.
title: Château Ferry Lacombe 2016 Mira Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: From 50 year old vines, this fruity wine is both crisp and clean and also full of warmer flavors. Citrus, pear and apricot notes all mingle in this delicious, concentrated wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2016 Cruet Vieille Vigne d'Idylle Jacquère (Savoie)

description: This rich, full-bodied wine has ripe green and white fruits along with a touch of minerality. It is a sophisticated wine that adds acidity to its complex array of flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Confidence 2015 Indiscreet Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is an attractively perfumed dry Muscat. Very floral, deliciously decadent in its richness, it has a crisp bite of spice and pepper. Drink the wine from 2017.
title: Yves Leccia 2015 Parcelle C281 Muscat (Ile de Beauté)

description: Typically crisp and fruity, this green-apple-driven wine has bright acidity and a tangy, citrus edge. It is bright, cool and refreshing, ready to drink now.
title: Bernard et Christophe Richel 2015 Domaine la Combelle Apremont Jacquère (Vin de Savoie)

description: A wine that tastes of its granite soil, very linear initially, only opening slowly to give plums, exotic spices and the ripest firm tannins. There is a lovely juicy final character to this intriguing wine.
title: Clos Teddi 2008 Nielluciu (Patrimonio)

description: This is the third vintage of a wine from a single parcel of ungrafted vines, produced in a walled vineyard within the ruins of the Sancerre city walls. The vines are a selection from the family's Les Romains vineyard. It cannot be labeled Sancerre because of the experimental methods used in its production. The wine is young, needing to age to develop its concentrated fruits and rich apple and apricot flavors. Tight and tense at this stage, it will develop slowly. Drink this rare wine from 2019.
title: Domaine Vacheron 2014 L'Enclos des Remparts Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Made from 100% Niellucciu (the Corsican name for Sangiovese), this attractive wine is ripe and softly textured. It has plenty of acidity, but its fruitiness is smooth—full of strawberry flavors and a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Poggiale 2016 Rosé (Corse)

description: This medium-bodied blend features aromas and flavors reminiscent of bubble gum and cantaloupe. It's mainly Grenache and Cinsault, which impart ample weight, balanced by some slightly bitter, pithy notes on the finish.
title: My Essential 2014 French Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: With the typical blend of a Côtes de Provence rosé, this is pale in color and light at heart. Made by the well-known Châteauneuf-du-Pape producer, it has some weight as well as ripe red fruits. A touch of tannin in the structure gives it an attractive tension as well as a tangy aftertaste.
title: Brotte 2015 Charles Brotte Cuvée Rose Secret Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Fruity scents of cherry, cranberry, red currant and plum are hit with good doses of menthol and licorice on the nose of this Rhône-style blend. The medium tannins are fine yet fleeting, lending only a subtle structure to the direct plum and cherry flavors.
title: Confidence 2013 Eloquent Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre Red (Vin de France)

description: Drawing a blend of Merlot, Tannat and Syrah from several regions in southwest France, this soft and fruity wine is light with a juicy mix of acidity and dry tannins. Berry fruits and a fresh aftertaste suggest it is ready to drink now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2013 Villa de Cocagne Red (Vin de France)

description: Dominated by Cabernet Franc, this is a pretty, pink, perfumed wine. It's light and fresh, crisply fragrant with wild strawberries. The acidity is balanced, integrated into the open, soft texture. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Rosé Excellence Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Belonging to the Stefani family for several generations, this estate has produced a tangy, zesty wine, textured and bright with red currant fruit flavors. It is so fresh and crisp with its lively, tight aftertaste.
title: Domaine Santa Giulietta 2015 Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: Yes, this is a rosé of Merlot from high altitude vineyards in the south of France. It's medium in weight, offering hints of red berries, wild herbs and wet stones and a clean, refreshing finish. Drink now.
title: Marrenon 2015 Rosé de Merlot Les Grains Merlot (Mediterranée)

description: More mineral and savory than tutti-frutti, this wine offers scents of damp moss and wet stone. It's medium bodied, with a silky texture and a long, mouthwatering finish.
title: Marrenon 2014 Les Grains Rosé de Merlot (Mediterranée)

description: Made from 100% Niellucciu (the Corsican name for Sangiovese), this attractive wine is ripe and softly textured. It has plenty of acidity, but its fruitiness is smooth—full of strawberry flavors and a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Poggiale 2016 Rosé (Corse)

description: This sophisticated and stylish Pinot Noir from the south of France was made a Burgundy producer. It has fine tannins, juicy red cherry-driven acidity and a warm, ripe aftertaste.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Tramier Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This smooth, creamy wine is attractively fruity with pleasant white fruit and almond flavors. The palate is soft, finishing with a hint of caramel.
title: Charles de Fère NV Réserve Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: The mountains south of Beaujolais produce a light style of Gamay. This wine is soft, juicy, easy and fruity with red-cherry flavor marked by fresh acidity. Drink now.
title: Signé Vigneron 2011 Domaine de Montaubourg Gamay (Côtes de Forez)

description: A blend of fruit from across the southwest yields a very fresh wine. It is crisp, textured, full of white fruit with an herbal edge. Drink now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

description: Made from 100% Gamay, this is a crisp wine with attractive acidity, red currant fruit and a spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Philippe Viallet 2016 Savoie Rosé (Vin de Savoie)

description: This 100% Pinot Noir rosé is ripe and full of red fruit, with a touch of caramel. It shows an attractive streak of acidity on the finish.
title: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Petite Perrière Pinot Noir Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This ripe, cherry-flavored wine has touches of toasty spice from wood aging. It's smooth and soft, with juicy acidity that offsets its rounded texture.
title: Barton & Guestier 2016 Bistro Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Ripe tropical fruit flavors give this wine from Sancerre producer Eric Louis its warm character. It has enough acidity to cut through the richness and give it a fruity aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
designation: Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly
title: Eric Louis 2016 Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Black fruit and soft tannins yield a wine that is rounded with some attractive texture. Its ripe black currant fruitiness is lifted by its crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)

description: This blend of six local Corsican varieties is the top wine from the Clos Venturi estate. Its dark color and blackberry perfume promises a rich, complex palate. It's serious—densely packed with both tannins and opulent fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Clos Venturi 2014 Chiesa Nera Red (Vin de France)

description: This wine shows ample weight and concentration for a rosé. Bold, berry-scented aromas lead into similar flavors on the palate, joined by a hint of white chocolate. The texture is silky, lingering gently on the long finish. Drink up over the next few months.
title: Les Vins de Vienne 2012 Reméage Rosé de Syrah (Vin de France)

description: A fat style of white wine, with wood and ripe peach and apricot flavors. Rounded, rich and ripe, it is full of southern warmth, tempered by enticing acidity.
title: Domaine Vico 2010 Collection White (Corse)

description: Fresh raspberry-flavored sparkling wine, with vivid acidity but also some softness. It has a bright, crisp texture, lively and refreshing. The wine comes from a small parcel next to the Hospices de Saumur.
title: Hospices de Saumur NV La Rosée Brut White (Vin Mousseux)

description: This is an impressive, while unusual, take on the Gamay as grown in Beaujolais. It is spicy and minty, with the long wood aging giving a rich, smooth texture to the red-cherry flavors. It needs another few months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Château des Bachelards 2014 Gamay

description: In this attractive blend, perfumed Vermentino is filled out by broad, ripe Chardonnay. The result is a wine that, while light, also has a rich character. Full of fruit, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Terra Vecchia 2016 Vermentino-Chardonnay White (Ile de Beauté)

description: Despite its Vin de France description, the fruit for this wine does come from the Loire Valley. It has just the right cool character along with lively acidity and a perfumed, white-flower character. Drink now.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This ripe, spicy blend of Niellucciu and Grenache has a rich while also fruity character. The tannins are generous, warm and allow the fruit and acidity to express themselves. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Clos Teddi 2015 Red (Patrimonio)

description: This peppery, fruit-flavored wine has a ripe character and wild strawberry flavors. Drink this full, spicy wine now.
title: Domaine Maestracci 2015 E Prove Rosé

description: This is a soft, off-dry wine with attractive red fruit and a smooth, rounded texture. Acidity balances to give a crisp, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Rosé Excellence Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: It's rare in Bordeaux to find a single-varietal wine, particularly made from Cabernet Franc.This impressive, spicy wine brings out all the perfumed character of the grape. It could do with some aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Château de Bel 2012 Franc de Bel Red (Vin de France)

description: Rich and fruity, this structured wine, still young, is firm and dense. Juicy black fruits are layered with acidity and given a solid character by the concentrated tannin core. Drink from 2017.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2013 Domaine Petroni Red (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: Dominated by Vermentinu, this is a rich while crisp wine. With its fresh apple flavors and good acidity, it is deliciously perfumed, ripe and poised with a strong line in minerality. Drink from 2017.
title: Yves Leccia 2015 YL Blanc White (Ile de Beauté)

description: The wine is just off dry, with a soft tropical-fruit character. It has pineapple as well as lemon fruit, crisp acidity and dried apricot flavors. The wine is crisp at the end, and ready to drink.
title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Petit Manseng-Sauvignon White (Vin de France)

description: This attractively soft wine is as gentle as the Gascony countryside, made with grapes from this region. It brings together many citrus flavors along with hints of pineapple and richer fruits. Drink now.
title: Famille Laplace 2016 Aramis Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This light, fresh and creamy wine balances cool acidity and bright citrus and apple-peel flavors. It is poised, fruity with a crisp, refreshing aftertaste.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2014 Cruet Altesse (Vin de Savoie)

description: While earthy on the nose, the palate bursts with huge berry flavors on this powerful wine. Bold, ripe fruit is cushioned by tannins and penetrating acidity, lending a dark feel to its structure. Drink from 2015.
region: Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée
title: Château Routas 2009 Cyrano Syrah (Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée)

description: This blend of Sciaccarellu and Niellucciu is delicious and light—full of refreshing red currant flavors and crisp acidity. It's bright, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Poli 2016 Sciaccarellu-Niellucciu Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: A rich wine, perfumed and intense. The tannins are a major element, although they ride with the sweet fruit and concentrated, complex wood and acidity. The wine is firm, impressively fruity and still likely to age further.
title: Henri Milan 2007 Le Vallon Red (Vin de Table Francais)

description: Made to be drunk young, this is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. It has a juicy blackberry flavor, plenty of acidity and a soft, smooth aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Rouge Tannat-Syrah Tannat-Syrah (Vin de France)

description: An attractive and ripely fruited Cab, this opens with lush aromas of blackberry, raspberry preserves and black plum that are complemented by spicy notes of bittersweet chocolate, toasted oak, pepper and cigar-box spice. The plush mouthfeel offers medium tannins and dense black-fruit flavors that linger on the spicy finish.
title: Michel Gassier 2014 Les Piliers Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: Made from 100% Gamay, this is a crisp wine with attractive acidity, red currant fruit and a spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Philippe Viallet 2016 Savoie Rosé (Vin de Savoie)

description: This 100% Pinot Noir rosé is ripe and full of red fruit, with a touch of caramel. It shows an attractive streak of acidity on the finish.
title: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Petite Perrière Pinot Noir Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is an easy, fruity wine made from Grenache. It has a clean, bright character, reflecting its red currant fruitiness and crispness.
title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is Malbec in a South American style: soft, with ripe and gentle berry fruit. It has a light structure and plenty of acidity on the finish.
title: Les Domaines Auriol 2016 Le Réveil Malbec (Vin de France)

description: This crisp, lively blend of Niellucciu (Sangiovese) and Grenache is deliciously refreshing. Its acidity and orange fruitiness are lifted by its tight texture and bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine Casa Rossa Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: Made from Caladoc, a grape variety created in 1958 by crossing Grenache and Malbec, this medium-bodied rosé is restrained in style, with ginger and citrus notes accenting strawberry fruit. It's dry and refreshing on the finish. Drink now.
title: Franck & Olivier Mousset 2016 Tendance Caladoc Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Made in a similar fashion to Sherry with a solera that is topped up, this was aged outside for a year to concentrate the wine and its flavors. A sweet wine, it has a richly nutty, peppery character to balance the ripe plum fruits. Softly textured, just hinting at the alcohol used for fortification, this is a rare, fascinating and very drinkable wine.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Estela Solera Malbec-Merlot (Vin de Liqueur)
