title: Bougrier 2016 Alain de la Treille Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This light-bodied wine shows citrus and green fruit touches. It has a soft aftertaste that makes it attractive and ready to drink.
title: Tussock Jumper 2016 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This wine is light and smooth. It has a crisp edge and hints of red berries, although the fruit seems dilute. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Terra d'Ortolo Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: This extracted wine has too hard an edge for the Vin de France category. Softer, more accessible black currant fruit is just hinted at underneath all its structure.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: This is a thin, fruity, simple wine with some red cherry flavors. Acidity and a touch of tannin completes the picture.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Spicy with strong toasty flavors, this is a wood-dominated wine. Fleeting glimpses of fruit show behind its barricade of oak-derived flavors. It might soften, but the balance is wrong.
title: Villebois 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This wine has the lightest possible taste. Its hints of green fruit, light, citrusy acidity and crisp aftertaste are barely discernible. Drink now.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2016 Perles de Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: The partner to Copains d'Abord, this wine sports a label of women having a good time at a party. The wine suits the image: fresh, fruity and juicy.
title: Domaine des Sablonnettes 2008 Les Copines Aussi Gamay (Vin de Table Francais)

description: This beautifully balanced wine has refreshing red fruit flavors cut by intense acidity and orange zest and lemon accents. Tangy, mineral and certainly worth aging, it's ready to drink but will be even better in summer 2018.
title: Clos Teddi 2016 Grande Cuvée Rosé (Patrimonio)

description: The deep color of this rosé reflects its richness. It's packed with red currant and berry fruit that gives a rich character and finishes with orange as well as red fruit notes. Drink now.
title: Clos Venturi 2016 Rosé (Corse)

description: This domaine—situated at a higher altitude than most Corsican vineyards—produces wines with an extra zest of freshness. This bottling is crisp and tight yet has great swathes of red fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Vico 2016 Rosé (Corse)

description: Fat, simple wine that offers ripe apples, but misses out on acidity. The finish has a candied character.
title: Silver Cap NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: With his background in Bordeaux, François Lurton knows how to handle Sauvignon Blanc to good effect. This wine is crisp and herbal, suggesting the cooler vineyards of the southwest in its style. It is packed with citrus and spice flavors. Refreshing and delicious, this is an immediately drinkable wine.
title: François Lurton 2015 Les Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This medium-pink rosé shows some heft but is mostly about refreshment. Passion fruit and peach notes give way to citrus zest on its crisp, vibrant finish. Drink now.
title: Marrenon 2016 Les Grains Rosé de Merlot (Mediterranée)

description: The Savigny-lès-Beaune-based producer shows his Pinot Noir skills with this wine. It's generous, with red plum flavor, light wood-aging notes, ripe tannins and crisp acidity. It's rounded and ready to drink.
title: Doudet Naudin 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This Grenache is deeply colored. Its flavor has the right spice and rounded character. Plenty of acidity keeps it crisp while a hint of pepper adds interest.
title: Florent Descombe NV Grenache (Vin de France)

description: This warm-climate Sauvignon Blanc is soft and very fruity, with the merest hint of herbal character. Its juiciness, acidity and peach flavors are refreshing.
title: Florent Descombe NV Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: With its pale color, this looks like a Provence rosé. It's soft and fruity, with spice, juicy red currant flavors and fine acidity at the end.
title: Tussock Jumper 2016 Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This light, crisp and fruity wine dances in the glass. With the acidity from Niellucciu very present, it's lively and bright, with a delicious final tang. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Terra Corsa Rosé (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: Made from Loire Valley fruit, this has the tangy, herbal character typical of cool-climate wines. Drink now.
title: Villebois 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This crisp, clean and zesty wine is lightly herbal and immediately appealing. It's full of citrus and gooseberry flavors and is ready to drink.
title: Vindivin 2016 La Belle Saison Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This wine is soft and creamy, with a layer of herbal fruitiness. As the name indicates, the grapes come from near two seas (mers): Sauvignon Blanc from the Atlantic and Viognier from the Mediterranean. The combination is refreshing and attractively, with a balance of crisp fruit and a soft texture.
title: Duo des Mers 2016 Sauvignon-Viognier White (Vin de France)

description: This is a soft, lightly earthy style of wine produced from grapes from across the Loire Valley. It has a strong herbal character and a touch of grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Fournier Père et Fils 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Situated on the east coast of Corsica, this vineyard is 50 hectares. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth and refreshingly fruity. There is a touch of spice as well as great waves of fresh acidity.
title: Domaine Alzitana 2015 Rosé (Corse)

description: This bottling is a blend comprised of wines from the 2011–2013 vintages, hence the nonvintage Vin de France labeling. Aromas of leather, clove and cinnamon come with a hint of adhesive bandage. The tannins are firm, so pair this with rare beef or lamb to bring forward the long, mouthwatering finish.
title: Laurence Féraud NV Plan Pégau Red (Vin de France)

description: This widely found local grape has produced a crisp, wine full complex berry and black fruits that are balanced with tannins. Richly structured, the wine is held together by the tannins and by the bright acidity typical of the grape. Drink now.
title: Clos Venturi 2013 Pur Sciaccarellu Sciaccerellu (Corse)

description: More deeply colored than the current fashion for pale rosés, this wine also has plenty of flavor. It offers juicy red-berry fruits, orange juice, and a crisp, direct texture. It is meant to go with food.
title: Clos Venturi 2015 Rosé (Corse)

description: Eight months on lees before bottling give this wine its rich, concentrated character. Melon and green-plum fruits are poised and stylish, pointed up by a touch of pepper. It is ripe, full bodied, ready to drink in 2017.
title: Clos Venturi 2015 Vermentino (Corse)

description: Round and fruity, this is cleanly made, with its soft character coming from the ripe strawberry fruit. It's a good candidate to pair with a fruit dessert or to serve as an apéritif.
title: Veuve du Vernay NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Fruity and fragrant, this rich and complex wine also has a strong sense of acidity. Putting it all together, the wine has weight, aging potential and a fine, zesty, tight texture. It needs to age, so drink this fascinating wine from 2016.
title: Domaine Labet 2011 Fleurs Chardonnay (Côtes du Jura)

description: This lightly fruity wine hints at strawberry fruits laced with soft acidity. There is a bitterness in the background that is not pleasant.
title: Charles de Fère NV Réserve Rosé Dry Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This rich, structured wine is made from 100% Niellucciu (Sangiovese) from a nine acre estate. Its black cherry flavors are bolstered by plenty of firm tannins and concentration, and its richness and density are now at peak maturity, so drink now.
title: Clos Alivu 2015 Nielluciu (Patrimonio)

description: With its spice, generous tannins from wood aging and ripe black plum skin and berry flavors, there's no doubting this is made from Sciaccerellu. Packed with juicy acidity and dark tannins, it needs aging. Drink from late 2018.
title: Clos Venturi 2014 Pur Sciaccerellu (Corse)

description: This is ripe and full in the mouth, with fine acidity and rich white stone fruit. It's delicious and floral, balancing its crisp texture with generous fruitiness. Great as an apéritif or with food, it's a refreshing wine to drink now.
title: Les Rocailles 2016 Chignin Jacquère (Savoie)

description: The wine comes from a large 300 acre vineyard in the eastern Costa Serena region. Dominated by Niellucciu (aka Sangiovese), it brings out all the acidity of the grape, restrained by ripe raspberry and apple fruitiness. It is a light, bright and crisp wine.
title: Domaine Vetriccie 2015 Rosé (Corse)

description: A pink sparkling wine made from Malbec, this shows signs of structure that overlay the red fruit, acidity, and some notes of toast and yeast. It all adds up to an attractive, fruity wine.
title: Jean-Luc Baldès NV Bul's Rosé Malbec (Vin Mousseux)

description: This ripe, sweet wine is rich and full of dried and fresh fruit flavors. It is spicy, with a touch of spirit on the palate as well as bold black-plum fruit, dense tannins and a sweet aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Château du Cèdre 2012 Le Cèdre Vintage Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

description: This creamy white is soft and smooth, with just the right kick of acidity at the end. Delicious and perfumed, it's ready to drink now.
title: Jean Perrier et Fils 2016 Altesse Cuvée Gastronomie Altesse (Savoie)

description: A blend of Mauzac and Loin de l'Oeil, commonly found in Gaillac, this bright, fruity and herbaceous wine is crisp and citrus-driven. A strong mineral edge to the texture adds bite to the aftertaste. Drink from 2015.
title: Château la Colombière 2014 Les Jacquaires White (Vin de France)

description: Despite being labeled Vin de France, this is a Gascon-style of herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc. It is crisp with gooseberries and fragrant acidity. Bright, just dry and fruity, it is a great wine to drink now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2013 La Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: A ripe, raspberry flavored wine that is crisp while also very fruity. It has attractive acidity and a refreshing, juicy aftertaste that is irresistible. Drink now.
title: Philippe Viallet 2015 Gamay Rosé (Vin de Savoie)

description: A blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier, this is attractive, fruity and perfumed. Touches of apricot balance with the green fruits and herbal edge. It's an easy wine to drink, best as an apéritif.
title: Cuvée Lion d'Or 2015 White (Vin de France)

description: Soft and gently fruity, this has red-currant as well as red-plum flavors lightly cut with acidity. The aftertaste is soft, almost off dry. It is immediately attractive and drinkable.
designation: Alain de la Treille Le Rosé
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Le Rosé Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat, not often found although working well here. The perfumed Muscat nicely softens the herbal Sauvignon to give a wine that is almost honeyed, certainly attractive as an apéritif.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Gabriel Sauvignon Blanc-Muscat White (Vin de France)

description: This is a soft wine from a major Rhône valley producer. Attractive acidity gives it a crisp, bright feel. Tangy citrus and clean, light fruitiness are all there, balanced and ready to drink. Drink now.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This wine is light and perfumed, with crisp red currants and a tangy orange-zest texture. It dances from the glass, refreshing and poised to finish.
title: François Lurton 2015 Les Fumées Blanches Rosé (Vin de France)

description: There is only the faintest of aromas on this soft, lightly juicy wine. It is a warm-climate wine, rounded, soft and gentle. The freshness comes at the end, bright and with a citrus touch.
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This is a gentle and easy-going Chardonnay. It is soft, lightly buttery and conveys apricot and ripe pear flavors. The aftertaste just touches on acidity.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: Ripe peach and nectarine aromas and flavors are at the forefront of this friendly, approachable Moscato, with touches of melon, pear and sweet orange to round it out. The palate is bright and balanced, with solid stone-fruit and pear flavors that finish fresh and easy.
title: Le Pépin 2015 Moscato (Vin de France)

description: Capitalizing on the fashion for Malbec, this wine is closer to Argentina than Cahors. It has soft tannins and a ripe and juicy flavor of red-berry fruits. Acidity and a soft aftertaste reinforce this New World feel.
title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)

description: This wine comes from the north of the Gascony region in Southwest France. It has some herbal character as well as a delicious cool feel. Riper fruit flavors such as peach and pineapple give a warmer, soft aftertaste.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 La Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This is a beautiful, ripe wine, flavored with quince, pear and apricots. It is above all the zesty texture that gives this wine its character and attraction. Fruity, structured and likely to age well, the wine should be drunk from 2015.
title: Domaine Daniel Dugois 2012 Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: Based in Burgundy, Tramier should know something about Chardonnay. This wine has some structure that tastes of cool vineyards. It is crisp, with refreshing white fruit and green-plum flavors, and is ready to drink.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Romantic Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This is a direct but tasty and well-balanced Pinot, with vibrant aromas and flavors of juicy cherry, blueberry and wild strawberry, all graced by hints of purple flowers and sweet spice. The mouthfeel is soft yet structured, with delicate tannins and a slight lushness that lingers on the finish.
title: Le Pépin 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: There's a rich character to this blend of 50% Grenache, 40% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre. It offers heady aromas of black cherry, boysenberry and raspberry that are laced with hints of vanilla, pepper and pencil shavings. It's well balanced and approachable, with a pleasant licorice kick to the finish.
title: Maison de la Villette 2014 Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre Red (Vin de France)

description: Chignin is one of the cru villages of Savoie. This wine is crisp, mineral and tight, with delicate layers of lemon and grapefruit acidity. Lively and bursting with fruit, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine les Fils de René Quénard 2015 Les Cantates Chignin Jacquère (Savoie)
winery: Domaine les Fils de René Quénard

description: A pale rose-colored wine, this is attractive, crisp and fresh. Lime and raspberry fruits are cut by tight, lively acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Terra Vecchia 2015 Niellucciu-Syrah Cuvée Armonia Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: This attractive blend of Grenache and Cinsault is fruity with lively acidity and a crisp, tangy texture. Raspberry and orange zest hang happily together. Drink now.
title: Domaine Grand St Paul 2015 Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Clean and fresh with lively citrus rind and red apple flesh aromas and flavors. It's not overdone and quite drinkable, with a soft toastiness that lingers through the finish. The texture is creamy and the swallow crisp.
designation: Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Chardonnay-Pinot Noir Sparkling Wine
title: Les Jamelles NV Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Chardonnay-Pinot Noir Sparkling Wine  (France)

description: Crisply herbal in nature, this is a citrus fruit flavored wine. It's full of refreshing acidity, giving it a lively, bright character and an aftertaste that reinforces that laser focus.
title: Bougrier 2016 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This light, lively and spicy wine has ginger and nutmeg flavors backed by a mineral texture and crisp, citrusy acidity. It's ready to drink.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Barcelo Vermentino (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: Pale in color, this rosé is soft and gentle. It has caramel and spice flavors that give a piquancy to the smooth, rounded red fruits. The aftertaste is just as soft.
title: Château Carignan 2015 L'Orangerie de Carignan Rosé (Vin de France)

description: While the blend ranges widely across Provence, the wine itself is a classic light, fruity rosé. With its tang of citrus, bright acidity and touch of spice, it is a delicious apéritif style wine.
title: Château de Berne 2015 Ludovic de Beauséjour Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Perfumed, light and fresh, this has acidity highlighting the white fruit and grapefruit flavors. It's a crisp wine, edged with an apple skin note.
title: Charles de Fère NV Reserve Nature Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This traditional method sparkling rosé is soft, rounded with strawberry fruit. There is a bitter almond edge to it that spoils its otherwise fruity character.
title: Grandin NV Rosé Dry Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Strange aromas emanate from this wine. They point to meat and gravy rather than fruit. So it's a shock to find that the wine is all fruitiness and crisp apple and pear acidity. It's a very textured and needs to age. Drink from 2016.
title: Rijckaert 2010 Les Sarres Savagnin (Côtes du Jura)

description: The nose has a yeasty, meaty character, while the palate is toasty. Rich flavors include ripe plum and vanilla followed by fragrant acidity at the end.
title: Frédéric Lornet 2011 Les Messagelins Chardonnay (Arbois)

description: There is only the faintest of aromas on this soft, lightly juicy wine. It is a warm-climate wine, rounded, soft and gentle. The freshness comes at the end, bright and with a citrus touch.
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This is a gentle and easy-going Chardonnay. It is soft, lightly buttery and conveys apricot and ripe pear flavors. The aftertaste just touches on acidity.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This wine is light and perfumed, with crisp red currants and a tangy orange-zest texture. It dances from the glass, refreshing and poised to finish.
title: François Lurton 2015 Les Fumées Blanches Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This delicate rosé offers a subtle bouquet of muddled cherry, carnation and mentholated berry. The light and slightly astringent palate boasts tangy, tart notes of currant and lime rind that linger through the medium-length finish.
title: La Vieille Ferme 2015 Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Black currant aromas lead on to a soft, off-dry wine with red-berry flavors and a stalky texture. With the softness, it is an immediate wine, easy to drink.
title: L'original French Kiss 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)

description: A selection of grapes from several hamlets (hameau in French), this light wine is soft and ready to drink. Lemon and green-herb flavors have a ripe, juicy character alongside flightly flat acidity.
title: Grandissime 2015 Le Hameau Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: It seems strange to have such a heavy, expensive bottle for a wine at this price. The soft, off-dry Chardonnay inside has a lightly fruity character, showing white fruits and the softest texture. It is easy and ready to drink.
title: Le Pépin 2015 Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This wine has soft flavors, fruity and bright, with a light, easygoing character that will sip down easily. Drink immediately, well chilled.
title: L'original French Kiss 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Lush scents of vanilla bean, raspberry sauce and cherry syrup show on the nose of this ripely fruited Pinot. The palate is light and direct, with virtually no tannic structure. A fleeting finish follows short flavors of juicy red plum and blueberry.
title: Café du Midi 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Grenache Blanc is light and fresh. Gently fruity, hinting at herbs and citrus and with an easy, open texture, it is a soft quaffing wine. The aftertaste is lightly sweet.
title: Belle Made For You NV White (Vin de France)

description: Very recognisably Pinot Noir, even if not Burgundian, this is an earthy wine that is full of spice and secondary, mature flavors. It is rich and impressively full while keeping the perfumed Pinot character. The wine, from a portion of the Château Montus vineyard, is ready to drink.
title: Vignobles Brumont 2009 Le Pinot Noir d'Alain Brumont Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This is the first vintage at this Fleurie property by new owner Alexandra de Vazeilles. It is rich, full of red fruits with considerable acidity. Hints of the 12 months wood aging show in the spice and smoothness at the end. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château des Bachelards 2014 Grand Vin Gamay

description: Just touched by honey and with a light spritz, this is a crisp, lemon and lime zest-flavored wine. It has great acidity with a yeasty character.
title: Pierre Boniface 2009 Les Rocailles White (Apremont)

description: An attractive wine. The Chardonnay is fresh, lightly mineral, with flavors of red apples, lemon zest and crisp acidity. A great party wine.
title: Barton & Guestier NV Cuvée Réservée Brut Chardonnay (Vin Mousseux)

description: As crisp and light as the mountain air of Savoie, this citrus and apple-bright wine offers great fruitiness and a tangy, orange-zest aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Philippe Viallet 2014 Les Cantates Chignin Jacquère (Vin de Savoie)

description: This plump, medium-bodied rosé is a blend of two-thirds Syrah and one-third Mourvèdre. It's a fruit-driven style, driven by hints of peach, cantaloupe and bubble gum, that should have broad appeal.
region: Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée
title: Jean-Luc Colombo 2014 Cape Bleue Rosé (Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée)

description: LIght and fresh, this is a crisp interpretation of Vermentino. Bright apple and lime flavors give a refreshing lift, while the aftertaste brings out lively acidity. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2014 Domaine Petroni Vermentino (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: A blend from a wider area than just Côtes de Provence, the wine is lightly spicy, full of red fruits and citrus acidity. There is a typical touch of pepper that adds extra interest to what is a refreshing wine.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 Juliette Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Made by the Barcelo family in the east of Corsica, the wine is ripe with strawberry fruit flavors that are balanced with apple acidity. It is lightly textured, just hinting at citrus. This is a fine apéritif style.
title: Domaine Vetriccie 2015 Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: This is not a true fortified wine but one made from late-harvest Tannat with some added alcohol before fermentation. It produces a delicious wine with superripe blackberry flavors and some tannins. Sweet and rich, it is ready to drink now.
title: Vignobles Brumont 2010 Montus Vintage Tannat (Vin de Liqueur)

description: Rich, fruity and soft, this wine has a tang of orange peel along with ripe citrus and red fruits. Fresh and crisp at the end, it is ready to drink.
title: Yves Leccia 2015 Domaine D'E Croce Rosé (Patrimonio)

description: Called Vermentinu in Corsica, the grape gives an aromatic wine with wildflower scents. On the palate, it's crisp with pears and red apples that are cut by the squeeze of citrus. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Clos Venturi 2015 1769 Vermentino (Corse)

description: Light in color and soft in texture, this fruity wine attains an attractive balance between crushed ripe strawberries and fresh acidity. Vibrant yet with ample weight, it is drinkable now.
title: Frédéric Lornet 2011 Trousseau des Dames Trousseau (Arbois)

description: From the Côtes de Provence, this is a lightweight sparkling rosé wine that boasts tasty strawberry and sour-apple flavors. A hint of chocolate creeps in on the finish.
designation: Le Grand Cros La Maîtresse Rosé Brut
title: Domaine du Grand Cros NV Le Grand Cros La Maîtresse Rosé Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Made from a blend of every local red grape imaginable, this is a serious, impressive wine. Its aromas and flavors conjure up the wild mountain scenery around the vineyard, giving black fruits, dense tannins and acidity. The spice at the end is another reminder of its origins. Drink from 2017.
title: Clos Venturi 2013 Chiesa Nera Red (Vin de France)

description: Bright red fruit highlights this soft wine. Acidity and hint of stalky tannins give its red berry flavors a boost. It's easygoing and ready to drink.
title: Fat Bastard 2016 Malbec (Vin de France)

description: Tannins predominate over fruit in this closed and tight wine. It should soften a little with time, so look for its red cherry fruit from the end of 2017.
title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Touches of vanilla and spice give this wine an attractive character. Its light, tangy texture adds crispness that supplements the bright acidity. Drink now.
title: M. & J-F Bertrand 2016 Fleur de Carbonnel Chardonnay (Vin de France)

description: This ripe, structured wine is full of cherry flavors and crisp acidity. Spice and dark chocolate notes make an appearance, but the wine is mainly about perfumed fruit.
title: Maison de la Villette 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Don't be fooled by this wine. Although it looks like a typical dry Provence rosé, it's medium sweet. With Black Muscat in the blend, it's soft and perfumed, its sweetness balanced by acidity.
title: Maison Marcel 2016 Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This attractive and fruity wine blends Niellucciu with Sciacerellu, both local Corsican grapes. The freshness is right there, crisp and hinting at red currant flavors and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2014 Domaine Petroni Rosé (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: A full-bodied wine with layers of toast over the ripe peach and lime fruits. With good structure, intense acidity and a general feeling of fruitiness, this already-attractive wine could age further. Drink until 2019.
title: Rijckaert 2011 Vignes des Voises Chardonnay (Côtes du Jura)

description: A 100% Roussanne wine is rare in its normal origin, the Rhône Valley. Here, in the mountains, it has produced this intensely perfumed, tightly textured wine that is both unusual and delicious. Crisply textured and with spice and a dry edge, the wine could be aged for a few months. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Philippe Viallet 2014 Les Cantates Chignin Bergeron Roussanne (Vin de Savoie)

description: This is a smooth, ripe style of Sauvignon Blanc. It hints at mango and pineapple as well as more crisply citrus fruit and shows an herbal, green fruit character on the finish. Drink now.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 La Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: This soft, warm version of Malbec has light tannins and attractive acidity. Fruity and crisp with bright red berry fruit, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2015 La Réserve Malbec (Vin de France)

description: This typical Provence blend with bubbles has a spicy, pepper-like edge as well as crisp fruit. Bright acidity and a creamy mousse give it an attractive, refreshing aftertaste.
title: Château de Brigue NV Bulles de Brigue Brut Nature Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This creamy white is soft and smooth, with just the right kick of acidity at the end. Delicious and perfumed, it's ready to drink now.
title: Jean Perrier et Fils 2016 Altesse Cuvée Gastronomie Altesse (Savoie)

description: Fortified dessert wines made from Malbec follow a tradition going back to the Middle Ages. This has a tawny-Port like quality, but is more structured and concentrated with a palate full of raisins and black-fruit flavors.
title: Château de Chambert NV Rogomme Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

description: This is a powerful, big-hearted Malbec, full of rich fruits and perfume. Flavors of black-plum skin and licorice are encased in firm tannins and juicy acidity that lingers on the finish. A wine with concentration meant for hearty meat dishes.
title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 Pont du Diable Malbec (Vin de France)

description: Soft and light, this is a fresh, fragrant wine, full of bright, lemony acidity and fruitiness. It's the perfect apéritif with its lively texture and bouncy, crisp feel.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2012 Cruet Jacquère (Savoie)

description: This very lemony wine is crisp and cool from the mountain vineyards of Savoy. It has a bright, creamy texture and baked-apple and pear flavors accented with a shot of citrusy acidity. It's a wine to drink now.
title: Domaine de l'Idylle 2012  Roussette de Savoie
